III. INVESTIGATION
1

Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4126
Section Sufficiency of staff.
Description (1) The licensee shall have a sufficient number of administrative,
supervisory, social service, direct care, and other staff on duty to
perform the prescribed functions required by these administrative
rules and in the agency's program statement and to provide for the
continual needs, protection, and supervision of residents.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 5/3/25, a youth physically assaulted another youth who was
sitting on a bed, resulting in a broken nose, black eyes, and a
swollen face. Staff were not nearby. Eventually staff pulled the
youth off of the other youth. The youth had to be taken to the
Emergency Department. The assaultive youth is supposed to
have a direct staff member monitor them at all times.
Investigation Complainant was contacted via email on May 7, 2025, and
reported they had no additional information.
Director was interviewed face to face at the facility on May 7,
2025, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Director reported he
watched the video of the incident and talked with Supervisor, and
Director felt staff responded appropriately. Director denied Youth
C being on 1:1 staffing or close observation at the time of the
incident. Director stated after the incident Youth C had a 1:1 staff
because Youth C requested to be separated from the group and
spend time in the classroom to feel more secure. Director
reported Youth C was not assigned to be on 1:1 staffing but due to
being in a separate area of the facility, away from the other youth,
there was only one staff with Youth C.
Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility on May 7,
2025, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Youth A reported
there was “a lot” going on with Youth C. Youth A described Youth
C as “lying on youth,” telling Youth B she “rapes little kids and
dogs.” Youth A stated Youth C threatened Youth B, then Youth B
said something about Youth C’s family and a fight broke out
between Youth B and Youth C. Youth A reported she was
standing in the doorway of Youth C’s room and ran in to get Youth
B off Youth C. Youth A stated she yelled for staff to help, and
Supervisor ran into Youth C’s room, separated Youth B from
Youth C, restrained Youth B and walked Youth B out of Youth C’s
room. Youth A reported she walked out of Youth C’s room, other
staff (could not recall who) tended to Youth C while Supervisor
released Youth B from the restraint. Youth A reported Supervisor
2

walked in the unit right when Youth B went into Youth C’s room
and the fight started. Youth A stated “a few” staff were in the area
when Youth B went into Youth C’s room and punched Youth C.
Youth A denied having any concern with how staff intervened.
Staff 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on May 7,
2025, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Staff 1 described
working the day Youth A and Youth B ran into Youth C’s bedroom
and “bum rushed” Youth C. Staff 1 stated he was sitting on the
couch talking with a youth (could not recall what youth) when the
incident took place. Staff 1 reported Staff 2 and Staff 3 were also
working in the unit. Staff 1 stated Youth C was in her bedroom,
while Youth A and Youth B were standing in Youth C’s doorway
talking with Youth C. Staff 1 reported he could not hear what was
being said as he was talking with a different youth but recalls Staff
3 being near Youth A and Youth B. Staff 1 stated Supervisor
walked into the unit right when Youth A and Youth B went into
Youth C’s bedroom and ran straight into Youth C’s bedroom. Staff
1 described Supervisor walking Youth B out of Youth C’s bedroom
while Staff 2 and Staff 3 stayed with Youth C in the bedroom.
Staff 1 reported Youth C was taken to the emergency room for a
broken nose. Staff 1 denied having any concerns with how staff
responded. Staff 1 stated the incident would have been a lot
worse if staff had not responded so quickly. Staff 1 denied Youth
C being on 1:1 staffing or close observation at the time of the
attack.
Youth B was interviewed face to face at the facility on May 7,
2025, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Youth B described a
lot of “he said/she said stuff” being said between her and Youth C.
Youth B reported Youth C made some false allegations toward
Youth B, so Youth B went into Youth C’s bedroom to fight her.
Youth B stated it took staff “a good 20 seconds” to break up the
fight. Youth B described Supervisor entering Youth C’s bedroom,
restraining Youth B and walking Youth B out of Youth C’s
bedroom then releasing Youth B from the restraint. Youth B
reported she believes there were two or three other staff on the
unit when the incident occurred but could not recall who the staff
were that were working. Youth B denied Youth C that day or ever
having a 1:1 staff or being on close observation when Youth B
entered Youth C’s bedroom. Youth B reported she did not have
any concerns with how staff broke up the fight.
Youth C was interviewed face to face at the facility on May 7,
2025, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Youth C described
sitting on her bed, in her bedroom when Youth A asked to talk with
3

Youth C from the doorway. Youth C stated Youth B came out of
nowhere, into Youth C’s bedroom and started punching Youth C.
Youth C reported “staff barely broke up the fight” and it took staff
at least three minutes to intervene. Youth C stated other youth
(could not recall what youth) kept yelling, “Oh my God, help her,
help her.” Youth C reported a “chubby lady” was working along
with Staff 1, Staff 2, and Supervisor. Youth C stated staff were not
paying attention and allowed Youth B to attack her [Youth C].
Youth C described Supervisor escorting Youth B out of Youth C’s
bedroom but could not really remembering what else happened
because she [Youth C] was in so much pain. Youth C reported
her nose got broke and she had a black eye. Youth C stated staff
took her to the emergency room after Youth C talked to the police,
because Youth C wanted to press charges on Youth B. Youth C
denied ever being on 1:1 staffing or being on close observation
while at the facility or during this incident.
Supervisor was interviewed via telephone on May 8, 2025,
while DHHS Worker was face to face with Supervisor at the
facility. Supervisor described coming back to the unit with pop
corn seasoning, Staff 3 walking up to Supervisor to ask to put
keys back and seeing Youth A and Youth B enter Youth C’s
bedroom and start punching Youth C. Supervisor reported he ran
into Youth C’s bedroom, Youth A put her arms up and walked out
of the bedroom right away, while Supervisor placed Youth B in an
upper torso restraint and walked her [Youth B] out of Youth C’s
bedroom. Supervisor stated Staff 1 and Staff 2 entered Youth C’s
bedroom to assist while Staff 3 remained outside of Youth C’s
bedroom. Supervisor reported Youth B calmed down immediately
and was released from the restraint. Supervisor stated Youth C’s
nose was bleeding and was taken to the emergency room.
Supervisor denied Youth C being on any additional staff
supervision before, during or after this incident. Supervisor stated
staff handled the situation quickly and appropriately. Supervisor
denied having any concerns with how staff responded.
Staff 2 was interviewed via telephone on May 23, 2025, in
collaboration with DHHS Worker. Staff 2 reported she was in
the unit when Youth B entered Youth C’s bedroom and started
punching Youth C. Staff 2 stated Supervisor ran into the bedroom
as well as herself. Staff 2 reported when she entered the
bedroom, she guided Youth A out of the bedroom while
Supervisor separated Youth B from Youth C. Staff 2 stated she
was standing near Staff 1 when Youth B entered Youth C’s
bedroom. Staff 2 reported the situation was handled quickly and
the youth were separated immediately. Staff 2 stated Staff 1, Staff
4

3, Supervisor and herself were all on the unit supervising the
youth and responded quickly with the correct techniques. Staff 2
denied Youth C’s being on 1:1 staffing the day of the incident.
Staff 3 was interviewed via telephone on May 23, 2025, in
collaboration with DHHS Worker. Staff 3 stated she caught
Youth A and Youth B whispering to one another and redirected
the youth. Staff 3 reported Youth B told Staff 3 she wanted to
apologize to Youth C, but Staff 3 told Youth B to wait and give it
sometime because Youth C was upset. Staff 3 stated Youth A
and Youth B walked toward Youth C’s bedroom, where Youth C
was sitting on her bed, so Staff 3 followed them [Youth A and
Youth B]. Staff 3 stated she asked Staff 1 to put something away
and as soon as she said that Youth A and Youth B ran into Youth
C’s bedroom and started punching Youth C. Staff 3 described
Supervisor running into Youth C’s bedroom, Youth A immediately
walking out of the bedroom and walking to the other side of the
room. Staff 3 reported Supervisor brought Youth B out of Youth
C’s bedroom while Staff 1 and Staff 3 tended to Youth C. Staff 3
denied Youth C being on any type of additional staff supervision
that day. Staff 3 stated she did not feel Staff 1 or Staff 2 were
very helpful but could not provided information on other ways staff
could have reacted. Staff 3 reported she quit the following day.
Video Reviewed:
Video footage of 05/03/2025 in the unit was reviewed on
05/07/2025, in collaboration with Director and DHHS Worker.
There is no video footage directly inside Youth C’s bedroom and
there is no sound on the video. Video shows Youth A and Youth
B standing outside Youth C’s bedroom. Staff 2 is standing near
Supervisor near the entrance of the door to the unit. Staff 1 is
also seen on camera sitting in a chair across the unit facing Youth
C’s bedroom. Staff 3 is seen walking near Youth A and Youth B
then turn and walk toward Supervisor. Youth B and Youth A enter
Youth C’s bedroom and Supervisor and Staff 2 are seen running
across the room into Youth C’s bedroom. Youth A walks out of
Youth C’s bedroom on her own and seconds later Supervisor
walks out of Youth C’s bedroom with Youth B in an upper torso
restraint. The restraint is discontinued as soon as Youth B is out
of Youth C’s bedroom. The entire video is 42 seconds long.
Documents Reviewed:
• Youth C’s After Visit Summary dated 5/03/2025. Diagnosis
of Youth C’s injury is a closed fracture of nasal bone.
5

• Incident Report involving Youth C dated 5/3/25. Incident
report is consistent with youth and staff interviews as well
as video review.
• Michigan Department of Health & Human Services
212100252 of Youth B’s restraint. Description of incident is
consistent with youth, and staff interviews, as well as video
review.
• Osceola Youth Center Staffing Ratios and Coverage Policy.
Policy documents, “Staff supervision of youth(s) must
include the following: Remain constantly alert to the facility
environment and constantly vigilant to the youth(s)'s
activities. Remain aware of and responsive to the behavior
and special needs of youth being supervised. Remain
aware of the exact number and location of all youth under
supervision. Stay alert for any indicators of impending
incidents such as escapes, disturbances or assaults.”
Analysis The facility is found in compliance as per staff and youth
interviews and video review, staff separated the youth in less than
42 seconds and Youth C was not assigned a direct staff monitor at
the time of the incident. Staff were nearby and able to quickly
intervene and stop the situation.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
